member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.GetAudioFilterList
member.summary: Release a list of module descriptions.

member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.ClearLastErrorMessage
member.summary: Clears the LibVLC error status for the current thread. This is optional. By default, the error status is automatically overridden when a new error occurs, and destroyed when the thread exits.
member.returns: Return the libvlc instance or NULL in case of error.

member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.GetLastErrorMessage
member.summary: A human-readable error message for the last LibVLC error in the calling thread. The resulting string is valid until another error occurs (at least until the next LibVLC call).
member.returns: Return the libvlc instance or NULL in case of error.

member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.AttachEvent
member.param: Event manager to which you want to attach to.
The desired event to which we want to listen.
The function to call when i_event_type occurs.
User provided data to carry with the event.
member.returns: Return 0 on success, ENOMEM on error.

member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.DetachEvent
member.param: Event manager to which you want to attach to.
The desired event to which we want to listen.
The function to call when i_event_type occurs.
User provided data to carry with the event.
member.returns: Return 0 on success, ENOMEM on error.

member.name: T:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.Free
member.summary: Frees an heap allocation returned by a LibVLC function.
member.returns: Return the libvlc instance or NULL in case of error.

member.name: M:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Win32Interops.GetProcAddress(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the address of an exported function or variable from the specified dynamic-link library (DLL).
member.param: A handle to the DLL module that contains the function or variable.
he function or variable name, or the function's ordinal value. If this parameter is an ordinal value, it must be in the low-order word; the high-order word must be zero.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the address of the exported function or variable. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Win32Interops.FreeLibrary(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees the loaded dynamic-link library (DLL) module and, if necessary, decrements its reference count. When the reference count reaches zero, the module is unloaded from the address space of the calling process and the handle is no longer valid.
member.param: A handle to the loaded library module.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.

member.name: M:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Win32Interops.LoadLibrary(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified module into the address space of the calling process. The specified module may cause other modules to be loaded.
member.param: The name of the module. This can be either a library module (a .dll file) or an executable module (an .exe file). The name specified is the file name of the module and is not related to the name stored in the library module itself, as specified by the LIBRARY keyword in the module-definition (.def) file. If the string specifies a full path, the function searches only that path for the module. If the string specifies a relative path or a module name without a path, the function uses a standard search strategy to find the module; for more information, see the Remarks. If the function cannot find the module, the function fails. When specifying a path, be sure to use backslashes (\), not forward slashes (/). For more information about paths, see Naming a File or Directory. If the string specifies a module name without a path and the file name extension is omitted, the function appends the default library extension .dll to the module name. To prevent the function from appending .dll to the module name, include a trailing point character (.) in the module name string.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the module. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Win32Interops.CloseHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.param: A valid handle to an open object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Win32Interops.SetParent(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes the parent window of the specified child window.
member.param: A handle to the child window.
A handle to the new parent window. If this parameter is NULL, the desktop window becomes the new parent window. If this parameter is HWND_MESSAGE, the child window becomes a message-only window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the previous parent window. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
